definitions.definition: The place where two rivers, streams, or other continuously flowing bodies of water meet and become one, especially where a tributary joins a river.
definitions.example: We encountered an abandoned boat at the confluence of the Mississippi and Ohio Rivers.

definitions.definition: The act of combining which occurs at the place where rivers and the lake meet.
definitions.example: The confluence of the rivers produced a great rush of water.

definitions.definition: A convergence or combination of forces, people, or things.
definitions.example: The confluence of our skills resulted in a successful home renovation project.

definitions.definition: The proportion of cells, in a culture medium, that adhere to each other
In rewriting systems, property describing which terms can be rewritten with other, equivalent terms.
